definition: to break up (a marriage, family etc)
to tear open/to tear down/to tear apart/to open
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
variant of 散[san4]

sentences.english: But the Queen Mother of ruthless, and finally he just break up this pair of happy couples.
sentences.chinese: 然而王母冷酷无情，最后硬是拆散了这对恩爱夫妻。

sentences.english: You had better ravel a bit of the left-over cloth to mend the tear in your trousers.
sentences.chinese: 你最好拆散一小块碎布头来织补你的裤子。

sentences.english: 3He said his daughter was worried that they might have separated a monogamous couple.
sentences.chinese: 3他说他的女儿担心他们可能拆散了一对终生伴侣。

sentences.english: He said his daughter was worried that they might have separated a monogamous couple.
sentences.chinese: 他说他的女儿担心他们可能拆散了一对终生伴侣。

sentences.english: My son stripped my watch and couldn't assemble it.
sentences.chinese: 我儿子把我的手表拆散后组装不起来了。

sentences.english: He was separated from him because of political opinions.
sentences.chinese: 人家要拆散他们父子是为了政治上的见解不同。

sentences.english: Phoebe tries to break it up and enlists help from Ross and Joey.
sentences.chinese: 菲比想拆散他们，向罗斯和乔伊求助。

sentences.english: Our laws should respect families following the rules -– instead of splitting them apart.
sentences.chinese: 我们的法律应当尊重循规蹈矩的家庭，而非拆散他们。

sentences.english: I hope your family is not angry with him. I hope his disease has not torn us apart.
sentences.chinese: 希望你家人不对他生气，希望他的疾病没把我们拆散。

sentences.english: The old ship was towed away to be broken up and sold as scrap.
sentences.chinese: 那艘旧船被拖走以便拆散当废铁卖了。

sentences.english: What could rip a star apart?
sentences.chinese: 是何方神圣能把一颗恒星拆散了？

sentences.english: The Qixi Festival day, on the street to make a practical joke, break up a pair is a pair.
sentences.chinese: 七夕这天，到大街上搞恶作剧，拆散一对是一对。

sentences.english: Olivier's marriage to the shallow Jacqueline separated the two friends.
sentences.chinese: 奥里维与肤浅的雅葛丽纳的婚姻把这两个朋友拆散了。

sentences.english: Divorce breaks up a lot of families.
The days of tactical, disjointed marketing campaigns and programs are numbered.
sentences.chinese: 在天的战术，拆散营销活动和项目编号。

definition: to rob sb of sth they cherish (idiom)
to squeeze in/to step in/to take part/to step between (two persons in a relationship)
to abandon/to discard/to renounce/to dump (sb)
to kill/to cause death/to do sb to death
an unhappy couple (formal writing)
to become enemies (idiom); to fall out with sb
to destroy
to undermine/to let someone down/to seduce someone away from something
to throttle/to choke to death
to betray
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
to drive a wedge between (allies, partners etc)
to help sb accomplish his aim/to help sb succeed/to complete/to make whole/to round off
to have a falling out/to have a big argument
to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
to snatch (esp related to a robbery)
